description: Borrowed from Latin anxius, from angō (“to cause pain, choke”); akin to Ancient Greek ἄγχω (ánkhō, “to choke”). See anger; angst.

adjectives.description: anxious (comparative more anxious or anxiouser, superlative most anxious or anxiousest)

entries.meaning: Having a feeling of anxiety or disquietude; extremely concerned, especially about something that will happen in the future or that is unknown.
examples: She was anxious to hear how her test results were.
I could tell she was anxious as she was biting her nails.

entries.meaning: (of things) Accompanied with, or causing, anxiety; worrying.
examples: There was an anxious wait before the results were revealed.
He is anxious to please, so you can count on him.
All the voters were anxious to hear the election result.
